intro: Spanoghea, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
